verses.verse: The heavens<WH8064> declare<WH5608> the glory<WH3519> of God<WH410>; and the firmament<WH7549> shows his<WH5046> handiwork<WH4639>.
Day<WH3117> unto day<WH3117> utters<WH5042> speech<WH562>, and night<WH3915> unto night<WH3915> shows<WH2331> knowledge<WH1847>.
There is no speech<WH562> nor language<WH1697>, where their voice<WH6963> is not heard<WH8085>.

Their chord<WH6957> is gone out<WH3318> through all the earth<WH776>, and their words<WH4405> to the end<WH7097> of the world<WH8398>. In them has he set<WH7760> a tabernacle<WH168> for the sun<WH8121>,
Which is as a bridegroom<WH2860> coming out<WH3318> of his chamber<WH2646>, and rejoices<WH7797> as a strong man<WH1368> to run<WH7323> a race<WH734>.
His going forth<WH4161> is from the end<WH7097> of the heaven<WH8064>, and his circuit<WH8622> unto the ends<WH7098> of it<WH5641>: and there is nothing hid from the heat there<WH2535>.
The law<WH8451> of the Lord<WH3068> is perfect<WH8549>, converting<WH7725> the soul<WH5315>: the testimony<WH5715> of the Lord<WH3068> is sure<WH539>, making wise<WH2449> the simple<WH6612>.
The statutes<WH6490> of the Lord<WH3068> are right<WH3477>, rejoicing<WH8055> the heart<WH3820>: the commandment<WH4687> of the Lord<WH3068> is pure<WH1249>, enlightening<WH215> the eyes<WH5869>.
The fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> is clean<WH2889>, enduring<WH5975> for ever<WH5703>: the judgments<WH4941> of the Lord<WH3068> are true<WH571> and righteous<WH6663> altogether<WH3162>.
More to be desired<WH2530> are they than gold<WH2091>, Yes<WH7227>, than much fine gold<WH6337>: sweeter<WH4966> also than honey<WH1706> and the honeycomb<WH5317>.
Moreover by them is your servant<WH5650> warned<WH2094>: and in keeping<WH8104> of them there is great<WH7227> reward<WH6118>.
Who can understand<WH995> his errors<WH7691>? Cleanse<WH5352> me from secret faults<WH5641>.

Keep back<WH2820> your servant<WH5650> also from presumptuous<WH2086> sins<WH4910>; let them not have dominion over me<WH8552>: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent<WH5352> from the great<WH7227> transgression<WH6588>.
Let the words<WH561> of my mouth<WH6310>, and the meditation<WH1902> of my heart<WH3820>, be acceptable<WH7522> in your sight<WH6440>, O Lord<WH3068>, my strength<WH6697>, and my redeemer<WH1350>.
